intro: Claoxylon dewevrei, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale grey bark and lanceolate leaves that are glossy on the upper surface. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open woodlands and savannas. Due to its aromatic properties, it has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a source of timber.
